description_txt: stated on October 22, 2013 in a discussion on CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: Emergency rooms account for "2 percent of all health care spending."

description_txt: stated on October 20, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: Wisconsin sold fresh water to California, helping that state's dairy industry, and "lost a bunch of jobs (and) a bunch of farmland."

description_txt: stated on October 25, 2013 in a campaign brochure.:
quote_txt: Says Ken Cuccinelli wants "to eliminate all forms of birth control."

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2013 in a gubernatorial campaign TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Barbara Buono "voted to raise her own pay 40 percent."

description_txt: stated on October 1, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: "We’re second only to Boston in college students per capita."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: "Test scores had gone up steadily for 40 years until No Child Left Behind and Race to the Top."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in a public hearing in Tampa:
quote_txt: For the state of Florida, "there is not an additional cost with implementation of the Common Core standards."

description_txt: stated on October 22, 2013 in an interview on "The O'Reilly Factor.":
quote_txt: In Florida, "300,000 people are going to lose their individual coverage because of Obamacare. Now those people next year, they don’t have health insurance."

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2013 in 'The Last Word with Lawrence O'Donnell":
quote_txt: "The IRS has been specifically forbidden ...  from ever actually pursuing either civil or criminal remedies" for people who don’t purchase health insurance.

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2013 in a Facebook page:
quote_txt: Wendy Davis is "threatening to raise taxes up to $35 billion."

description_txt: stated on October 10, 2013 in a newspaper op-ed:
quote_txt: Georgia "spends in the top 10 nationally on education, yet, most of our education metrics hover in the bottom five."

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2013 in Facebook posts:
quote_txt: Congress, criminals, Scientologists and other groups are exempt from Obamacare.

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in a campaign speech.:
quote_txt: Says "there are actually more people in poverty now than there were when we started" the War on Poverty.

description_txt: stated on September 25, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: "Wisconsin is not as obese as the national average is. The national average, 35.7 percent of the population is obese. In Wisconsin, it's closer to 26 percent."

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2013 in a broadcast of the Sean Hannity Show on WBAP AM:
quote_txt: "In 45 out of 50 states, on average men are seeing their premiums double, going up 99 percent. Women up 62 percent."

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2013 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: Common Core "is not from the federal government," they "do not have their fingerprints on this thing at all."

description_txt: stated on October 14, 2013 in a speech in Falmouth, Maine:
quote_txt: "About 47 percent of able-bodied people in the state of Maine don’t work."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2013 in an interview on "Fox and Friends":
quote_txt: "Woodrow Wilson borrowed $30 billion to fund World War I in 1917. That money has not been paid back. And we are still paying interest on it."

description_txt: stated on October 20, 2013 in an interview on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: "I never was in favor of shutting down the government. … (I) voted to fund the government fully."

description_txt: stated on October 1, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: Milwaukee County has "a parks capital budget that’s bigger than it’s been in the last 10 years."

description_txt: stated on October 2, 2013 in a news release:
quote_txt: Gov. Lincoln Chafee has imposed "a mandatory abortion fee" on all Rhode Islanders who buy health insurance through the state’s Obamacare exchange.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • October 23, 2013

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2013 in an interview on MSNBC's 'Morning Joe':
quote_txt: "No one beta-tested" healthcare.gov.

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2013 in an audio recording described as a radio ad:
quote_txt: "Wendy Davis opposes any limits on abortion."

description_txt: stated on October 20, 2013 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says under President Barack Obama, the debt increased by 23 percent, which was less than under any president going back to Ronald Reagan.

description_txt: stated on October 20, 2013 in an appearance on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "As a result of Obamacare, we are becoming something of a part-time employment country."

description_txt: stated on July 26, 2013 in a statement given to the Tampa Bay Times:
quote_txt: Common Core is being "used by the Obama Administration to turn the Department of Education into what is effectively a national school board."

description_txt: stated on September 29, 2013 in a newspaper op-ed:
quote_txt: According to a federal report, Obamacare will increase the long-term federal deficit by $6.2 trillion.

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2013 in a public address:
quote_txt: "Half of all CEOs say that the shutdown and the threat of shutdown set back their plans to hire over the next six months."

description_txt: stated on October 4, 2013 in a campaign brochure.:
quote_txt: "Mark Herring voted to allow sex offenders, including rapists, to serve shorter sentences."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in during a public hearing:
quote_txt: "Common Core expects English teachers to spend at least half of their reading instructional time at every grade level on informational texts."
